column4: How can I use ffmpeg to convert a ton of files all at once, that are in subdirectories of directories. (convert: /path/allfiles)
some shell scripting/ and use of find. is one way.
find is worth learning about. :)
or write up a script/batch file that does the work in parts. so you can monitor whats going on.
you could put it in a text editor and edit each line, with ffmpeg -whateveroptions  yourstuff  otheroptions     then run it as a batch file..
and how would I tell it to keep the name?
give it the name as an output file. Check the ffmpeg docs.
edit each line lol? there's 1,459 lines.
